scenario.setup: User wants to test a skill but provides no content.
expected: Asks the user to provide the SKILL.md content
Asks which persona it belongs to
Asks whether a rubric already exists

conversation.content:
I'd be happy to help you test a skill! To get started, I need to see the skill itself.

Could you share:

1. **The SKILL.md content** — paste it directly, point me to a file, or describe what the skill does
2. **The persona it belongs to** — which AI persona or assistant is this skill for?
3. **An existing rubric** — do you already have a `rubric.yaml` for this skill, or are we creating one from scratch?

If you're not sure where to start, just paste the SKILL.md and we'll go from there.

structural.description: Agent obtains and reads the skill content before defining criteria
structural.justification: The agent asks for the SKILL.md content but has not yet read or obtained it, so it cannot have identified the persona and key behaviors before proposing criteria — the criterion requires the agent to actually read the skill content first, which hasn't happened yet.

structural.description: Agent identifies concrete, checkable behaviors the agent should exhibit
structural.justification: The agent does not propose any structural criteria with descriptions and check statements; it only asks clarifying questions about the skill to be tested.

structural.description: Agent identifies subjective quality dimensions with weights
structural.justification: The agent did not propose any pedagogical criteria with descriptions and weight levels; it only asked clarifying questions about the skill to be tested.

structural.description: Agent identifies things the agent must never do
structural.justification: The agent does not identify any anti-patterns or things it must never do; it only asks clarifying questions about the skill to be tested.

structural.description: Agent designs test scenarios covering different interaction types
structural.justification: The agent has not proposed any test scenarios with setup, messages, or expected behaviors; it is only asking clarifying questions to gather information before proceeding.

pedagogical.description: Structural criteria derive from the skill's own defined steps and behaviors
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet received any skill content to evaluate, so it cannot derive structural criteria from the skill's own defined steps and behaviors — the response is just an intake prompt with no skill-specific criteria present.

pedagogical.description: Scenarios test different types of interactions (happy path, edge case, boundary, minimal input)
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not demonstrated any scenario coverage at all, as it has only asked clarifying questions without generating or discussing any test scenarios across different interaction types (happy path, edge case, boundary, minimal input).

pedagogical.description: Criteria are specific enough to evaluate consistently across different evaluators
pedagogical.justification: The agent asks clarifying questions that could lead to testable criteria (skill content, persona, rubric), but hasn't yet produced any criteria that could be evaluated for specificity or consistency across evaluators.

pedagogical.description: Anti-patterns reflect the persona's constraints, not just generic quality concerns
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet demonstrated any anti-patterns grounded in the pedagogical persona's constraints, as the conversation is only at the initial information-gathering stage with no substantive skill evaluation or feedback provided yet.

anti_patterns.description: Agent defines criteria too vague to evaluate consistently
anti_patterns.justification: The agent's response only asks clarifying questions to gather information and does not define any evaluation criteria at all, vague or otherwise.

anti_patterns.description: Agent creates only one test scenario or only happy-path scenarios
anti_patterns.justification: The agent has not yet produced any test scenarios — it is still in the information-gathering phase, asking clarifying questions before generating anything, so the anti-pattern cannot apply.

anti_patterns.description: Anti-patterns don't reflect the persona's specific constraints
anti_patterns.justification: The agent did not produce any anti-patterns in this response; it simply asked clarifying questions to gather necessary information before proceeding.
